# AdveRSArial Crypto (Baby) - 306

Looking at `n` in base 2 we can find something interesting:

```py
Python 3.10.12 (main, Nov 20 2023, 15:14:05) [GCC 11.4.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> bin()
''
```

This pattern remind me another [CTF](https://github.com/NeKroFR/Writeups/blob/main/Hackday/2024/qualif/Cryptography/show%20me%20the%20way.md).

So I made this sage script:

```py
from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes, bytes_to_long
from sage.all import *

n = 
e = 65537
c = 0x000c307feca4371acecab2690800586b967909e12ec3e80184666ca161129f86c6cd87e276127a1f9b672b66ba3d715321b24f7d660a928d829c154dcdc0634b99f51e281c2e138f77a04694ff7aeec25c938cf769fbd7d3f2968f0b96fc5d38a8f742f6a46e70d7eae8280ed61f0328df36497f0cb6251b0e13a2bc5adce6344a

poly = sum(e * x^i for i,e in enumerate(Integer(n).digits(2)))
(p, _), (q, _) = poly.factor_list()
p, q = p(x=2), q(x=2)

phi = (p-1)*(q-1)
d = pow(e, -1, phi)
print(long_to_bytes(pow(c, d, n)))  
```
